intro: Stemonurus frutescens, commonly known as the purple false heather, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple, often blooming in the spring. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to thrive in dry or rocky environments. Stemonurus frutescens is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate poor soil conditions.
